prizes.motivation: for its efforts to combat hunger, for its contribution to bettering conditions for peace in conflict-affected areas and for acting as a driving force in efforts to prevent the use of hunger as a weapon of war and conflict
for its work to draw attention to the catastrophic humanitarian consequences of any use of nuclear weapons and for its ground-breaking efforts to achieve a treaty-based prohibition of such weapons

name.nat: International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN)
name.en: International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN)

prizes.motivation: for its decisive contribution to the building of a pluralistic democracy in Tunisia in the wake of the Jasmine Revolution of 2011
for its extensive efforts to eliminate chemical weapons

name.nat: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
name.en: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons

prizes.motivation: for over six decades contributed to the advancement of peace and reconciliation, democracy and human rights in Europe
for their efforts to build up and disseminate greater knowledge about man-made climate change, and to lay the foundations for the measures that are needed to counteract such change

location: North America, USA, New York, NY

prizes.motivation: for their efforts to create economic and social development from below
for their efforts to prevent nuclear energy from being used for military purposes and to ensure that nuclear energy for peaceful purposes is used in the safest possible way
for their work for a better organized and more peaceful world

location: North America, USA, New York, NY

prizes.motivation: in recognition of the organisation's pioneering humanitarian work on several continents
for their efforts to ban and remove anti-personnel landmines
for their efforts to diminish the part played by nuclear arms in international politics and, in the longer run, to eliminate such arms

name.nat: Pugwash Conferences on Science and World Affairs
name.en: Pugwash Conferences on Science and World Affairs

prizes.motivation: for preventing armed clashes and creating conditions for negotiations

location: North America, USA, New York, NY

prizes.motivation: for spreading authoritative information and by creating awareness of the catastrophic consequences of  nuclear  war

name.nat: International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War
name.en: International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War

prizes.motivation: for its efforts to heal the wounds of war by providing help and protection to refugees all over the world
for promoting the fundamental rights of refugees

name.nat: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
name.en: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

prizes.motivation: for worldwide respect for human rights
for creating international legislation insuring certain norms for working conditions in every country
for its effort to enhance solidarity between nations and reduce the difference between rich and poor states

location: North America, USA, New York, NY

prizes.motivation: for the efforts to take care of wounded soldiers and prisoners of war and their families
for the great work it has performed during the war on behalf of humanity
for promoting the principles of the Geneva Convention and cooperation with the UN

prizes.motivation: for promoting the principles of the Geneva Convention and cooperation with the UN

name.nat: Ligue des Sociétés de la Croix-Rouge (League of Red Cross Societies)

prizes.motivation: for their pioneering work in the international peace movement and compassionate effort to relieve human suffering, thereby promoting the fraternity between nations
for their pioneering work in the international peace movement and compassionate effort to relieve human suffering, thereby promoting the fraternity between nations
for having carried on the work of Fridtjof Nansen to the benefit of refugees across Europe

name.nat: Office international Nansen pour les Réfugiés (Nansen International Office for Refugees)

prizes.motivation: for acting as a link between the peace societies of the various countries, and helping them to organize the world rallies of the international peace movement

name.nat: Bureau international permanent de la Paix

prizes.motivation: for its striving in public law to develop peaceful ties between nations and to make the laws of war more humane
